info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 3:55AM PST until January 04 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing and drifting snow ongoing. Total new snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches with wind gusts 45 to 65 mph at times, especially over the higher terrain and in areas open to winds from the south and southwest. * WHERE...In the Cascades including Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Willamette Pass, and portions of Highways 62, 138, and 230. It also includes Highway 140 at Lake of the Woods pass. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow will limit visibilities at times, and could impact morning and evening travel. These conditions could limit visibility at times making travel difficult to impossible. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Despite ongoing light snow showers, gusty winds are still occurring in some locations. Wind and snow will increase again this morning and persist into the evening. Blizzard-like conditions are likely. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
